metadata.title: CVE-2016-4429 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the clntudp_call function in sunrpc/clnt_udp.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote servers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly unspecified other impact via a flood of crafted ICMP and UDP packets. Aldy Hernandez discovered an unbounded stack allocation in the sunrpc implementation in the GNU C Library. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-4429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.24-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.24-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.24-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libtirpc-common - 0.2.5-1.1
libtirpc3 - 0.2.5-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.24-0ubuntu1').
libtirpc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.5-1.1').
ntirpc package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
